通关了原版半条命后，时隔两年，我通关了蓝色沸点，本作没有中文配音和翻译，为此搁置了两年，但本作是原版半条命的分支，不同于弗里曼的主角光环，本作做出了除主角外以配角巴尼为视角，写出了普通人无法像主角一样，但却做到了在发生了黑山事件后，做到了人最根本的活着，本作虽然短但却值得想原版半条命一样去慢慢斟酌。

Utter crap, even by the standards of the day. Buggy beyond belief, confusing and flat level design, a story that quite literally goes out of it's way to hide details, because GearBox didn't know what intrigue was back then either and a whack difficulty curve. The only reason this crap is "Very Positive", is because of nostalgia. Take that away, and you're left with a typically GearBox experience. Half-arsed on half a brain-cell.

8/10

Don't get me wrong, this game is OK. When it's functioning properly, at least. There are certain sections of the game that are incredibly bugged to the point of having to spend at least 10-20 minutes trying to figure out a fix. This happened to me three times, and at a certain point I was just getting tired of it. I'm glad I pushed through it though, because this game does pick up quite a lot in the second half.

However, this game does not feel as innovative as some other titles in the series, notably Half-Life 2. It sort of feels like a rehash of the first game, just with a different main character (not that it really matters, all you ever see of Calhoun is his hands). I suppose this game is worth it if you received it as part of the Valve bundle or whatever, but don't go into it expecting a clean, polished game.

Blue Shift is kinda the black sheep of the original Half Life expansions, while Opposing Force did a lot to expand the strengths of the original Half Life while also being a more streamlined package, Blue Shift happens to be shorter on a first time play through, while also including much more exposition. This is because it was originally created for the Dream Cast port, hell on my first time playing the Half Life games I skipped Blue Shift because I heard it wasn't that important, but when I finally decided to play Blue Shift one day via a complete whim, I actually kinda liked it.

Blue Shift doesn't do much, unlike Gordon Freeman or Adrian Shepard, this time you're a security guard, which means that you're not getting any fancy suits of armor or any of the cool tech they get during their adventures, instead you're forced to settle with body armor you can scavenge, in concept I actually like this mechanic a lot, the prospect of being much more vulnerable during the Resonance Cascade can make some really interesting combat scenarios (something which the mod Echoes did to great benefits years later), hell that's probably why I've played the game over and over, but Gearbox never really balances your limited arsenal in any meaningful way, I don't think you even get any trip mines, like come on! All I have is body armor! Allow me to trap and outsmart my enemies in creative ways! 

Personally, this is a game that could really benefit from an update or mod that further balances your arsenal and combat abilities in ways that force you to think about how you approach combat scenarios, think you fall from too high a distance and now you can't sprint, mechanics that actually force you to think about to do, as well as including any punishments for rash behavior could really make a no death run really fun. 

Still I probably like Blue Shift more than most people, it isn't that bad if you approach it with an open mind, and I've probably played it more times than Opposing Force, but it also doesn't take the necessary risks or deviations that it needed to stand out. 

6/10

하프라이프1을 플레이후 바로 하프2를 하기 앞서 해보고 싶은 감정이 생겨 블루쉬프트를 실행하게되었다
하프라이프1의 부족한 한국어 더빙이 그리울만큼 영어는 알아들을수 없지만 기본적인 게임의 진행성과 스토리등을 이해하는데는 무리가 되진 않았다 하지만 정확한 요점이나 진행성이 이해는 할수가 없어 아쉬웠다 여튼 하프1과 비교했을땐 뭔가 같은 조작감?이지만 그래도 하프1보단 업그레이드 되었단걸 하면서 느끼었다 이번에도 난이도 어려움으로 진행 하였지만 하프1과 같은 짜증나는 일은 발생하지 않았다 하프1에서는 툭하면 이상한 데미지 피해량과 가해량이 이상하리 만큼 다가왔기에 플레이에 너무 짜증이 났지만 블루쉬프트는 그 후속작?은 아니지만 그래도 나름 실력과 꼼수가 통하는 게임이라고 느낀다 느끼기에는 하프1보단 블루쉬프트가 훨씬 재밌었고 나름 할맛이 났었다
결말도 맘에드는 결말이었고 나름 만족한다 블루쉬프트 하프1클리어후 바로 하는게임 이지만 나름 발전했다 느낀다 재미또한 있다.

Lo ricordavo moooolto meglio.

A differenza di Opposing Force che è un po' troppo difficile (anche a difficoltà facile), questo è bilanciato molto meglio. Ricorda il capitolo originale.

Quello che manca a Blue Shift è l'ispirazione nel design dei livelli. Sono tutti piatti e scialbi, facilmente dimenticabili. Inoltre, la durata del gioco è esageratamente bassa. Non riesci nemmeno ad ad assaporarlo, acquisire armi potenti che il gioco finisce. I nemici più forti che incontri sono i soldati base o l'alieno grosso che ti spara con quell'arma che in half life 1 si ricarica da sola dopo pochi secondi..... Fine, nient'altro.

Davvero deluso. Avevo un ricordo diverso. Mi era rimasta la convinzione che Blue Shift fosse migliore di Opposing Force, ma non è assolutamente così.

Со второй попытки все же Gearbox удалось "почувствовать" Half-Life. По сути Blue Shift даже не ощущается чем-то отдельным, в отличии от Opposing Force, а скорее как сейчас это модно - сюжетное DLC. Более медленный геймплей, лучше левел-дизайн и, главное отличие от OF - лучше сбалансирована сложность. Плюс без багов.

I had just finished playing Half-Life and heard about the two expansion packs Half-Life Opposing Force and Half-Life Blue Shift. I first played Half-Life Opposing Force, it's a really good game I really recommend it. So next I decided to play Half-Life Blue Shift. It's definitely not as good as Opposing Force, but its not bad either, its just more Half-Life gameplay and that is great. It does not introduce new creatures, weapons, or mechanics like Opposing Force did, but its not really trying to be as big and grand as Opposing Force and the story was still engaging and revealed some interesting Half-Life Lore even though some fans will argue over whether or not it's cannon.  
I would also like to mention that this game seems to have multiplayer because on the bottom right you can click "servers" and there is a server browser, but unlike Opposing Force I did not see any servers so it looks like Multiplayer is dead.

I enjoyed my time with the game, playing through Barney Calhoun's adventure to escape Black Mesa. Watching more of the chaos unfolding at Black Mesa during the events of Half-Life from a different point of view. In fact in this game we get insight on what was going on right before the incident.
All in all I would recommend the game to anyone who still has an itch for some more original Half-Life action after playing Half-Life and Opposing Force.
